title: Bully
notes: I had some fps drops, im not sure if it was beacuse of linux.

title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
notes:
You must hit spacebar when the game loads or it will stay on one screen.
opening cut-scene doesn't play  but other in-game cut-scenes do. 
locked at 30fps.

title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
notes: Anti-aliasing higher than x2 results in a black screen and sound has crackling issues which can be fixed by adding PULSE_LATENCY_MSEC=60 %command% to Steam launch options. Xbox 360 controller works ootb!

title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
notes: The game starts, but requires you to press the keys to start the game and level, otherwise it looks hung. It's impossible to see the opening scene. Otherwise works well.

title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
notes: Press A/Enter on the loading screen to show the main menu. Changing the AA setting causes game to black screen.

title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
notes: No crashes or anything, but the performance is not so great

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 570 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-zen1-1-zen, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Bully itself runs fine. Minor sound hiccups, no graphics issues, Gamepad works out of the box, yet it crashes frequently – I can usually do two missions/activities at a time but the third throws you back to the desktop (also going to map/activities overview). As this behavior is apparently common on modern Windows systems too, I rate it Silver.
title: Bully: Scholarship Edition

notes: Was running under Ubuntu 18.04, but now crashes after loading screen following most recent Ubuntu update. No error visible in any log, including proton log.
title: Bully: Scholarship Edition

notes: FMVs don't work, press spacebar/enter/a button at the initial loading screen and at anypoint you think the game hangs.  Don't bother using AA, if you do you will get a black screen and the game will refuse to launch until you delete your config files.  Silent patch and widescreenfix doesn't seem to work.  Otherwise the game runs and looks just as good as it does on windows, but keep in mind this is still a shoddy port and proton won't ever fix that.
title: Bully: Scholarship Edition
